Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2011 03:36PM ireland20 wrote: Hi, I was diagnosed on the 14/6/2011, I had the lump removed on the 4th July at this time they Removed 3 nodes and it was found that cancer is in a micro form on two of them. As I had a holiday Booked with my 3 Kids aged 3, 7 and 14, to florida, the surgeon told me to go ahead on hols and she would operate to remove all nodes on the 15th aug,(I'm back in ireland on the 10th aug, she also wants to do a second incision as the clearance was only half mm. After reading your posts I'm now more frightened as I am beginning to think my surgeon is to laid back and that I should have pushed her to operate sooner so I could get treatment started. Also s he told me she was doing a routine cat scan, however I've read this is only done if they think the cancer has spread. The surgeon told me I wasn't a stage iv, but might be a stage 3, when I looked panicked she told me I could still be a 2 or maybe a 1. I'm beginning to think she is telling me anything and I am defo regretting coming on holidays before treatment. Has anyone any advice as I am cried out.
Posts.Title: In shock bella76 chrissyb

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2011 06:42AM ireland20 wrote: Thanks Nanadeb, I am truely finding this chatroom helpful, its good not to feel so alone. I hope Merrysee and zombean80,your results come in right for you, I shall say a prayer for you today, Bella, I am amazed at your strength and plan to try and pull it together so my Kids get to enjoy the last few days of this holiday without me being all doom and gloom and teary! I am joining the "we will beat this"club as and from now.
